title: 115_hr258
content: PROHIBITION ON USE OF FUNDS TO PROVIDE COVERED ASSISTANCE TO AL QAEDA, JABHAT FATEH AL-SHAM, AND ISIL, AND TO COUNTRIES SUPPORTING THOSE ORGANIZATIONS. Prohibition on the use of funds to provide covered assistance to Al Qaeda, Jabhat Fateh al-Sham, and ISIL, and any affiliated individuals or groups. The Director of National Intelligence is responsible for determining affiliations with these organizations within the past 12 months. The Director of National Intelligence must review and determine affiliations with Al Qaeda, Jabhat Fateh al-Sham, and ISIL every 6 months, providing detailed intelligence assessments and geographic locations to congressional committees. The Director of National Intelligence must review affiliations with Al Qaeda, Jabhat Fateh al-Sham, and ISIL every 6 months, providing detailed assessments and geographic locations to congressional committees. No funds can be used to support countries that have provided assistance to these terrorist groups within the last 12 months. The Director of National Intelligence must review affiliations with terrorist groups every 6 months and provide assessments to congressional committees. No funds can support countries that have assisted Al Qaeda, Jabhat Fateh al-Sham, or ISIL. The Director of National Intelligence must provide detailed assessments every 6 months to congressional committees on countries providing covered assistance to terrorist groups like Al Qaeda, Jabhat Fateh al-Sham, or ISIL. The assessments should include the geographic location, intelligence assessment, and description of the assistance provided. The Director of National Intelligence must provide detailed assessments every 6 months to congressional committees on countries providing covered assistance to terrorist groups like Al Qaeda, Jabhat Fateh al-Sham, or ISIL. Additionally, the Director must brief the appropriate congressional committees on any other individuals or groups considered but not determined to be affiliated with the mentioned terrorist organizations, along with the justification for not making the determination. The Director of National Intelligence must report to congressional committees every 6 months on countries providing assistance to terrorist groups like Al Qaeda, Jabhat Fateh al-Sham, or ISIL. The committees must also be briefed on any other entities considered but not determined to be affiliated with these terrorist organizations, along with the justification for not making the determination. The term "covered assistance" includes defense articles, services, training, logistical support, military aid, intelligence sharing, and cash assistance. Defense articles and services are defined in sections 47(3) and 47(4) of the Arms Export Control Act.
